On Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 12:41
 
PM Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
 
Hi, Jas. We haven’t met, I’m a Principal Consultant at LCW. Your name was forwarded to me by Patricia Coleman (friend and colleague, SIETAR USA in common) and Sarah Nodarse. I understand you worked with us last year, to help Sarah culturally adapt a session for one of our clients (Boston Scientific Corp). Sarah is no longer at LCW, and I am now the account managers for BSC. 
 
We completed the content a few months ago, and the client is now ready to schedule a couple of sessions. Not the same session you helped us with (which is called “Leading Inclusively”) but a pre-req 2-hr session called “Understanding Your Cultural Lens”. We’re looking for a Canadian cultural competence SME and facilitator to help us deliver this course, twice. The target audience are people leaders across departments. 
 
We have the content and facilitator notes ready, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.  Client’s locations in Canada are Brampton, Mississauga, Ottawa, and Montreal.
 
I’m happy to walk you through the content. It does have some content about the Intercultural Development Continuum/ IDI – are you certified in this assessment? And if not, how familiar are you with this material?
 
The client has just proposed the following dates (t
he Client’s Canada team would select 1 date from round 1 and one date from round 2):
 
Round 1 options:
Tuesday, May 6, 2025 – 10 am – 12 pm ET
Tuesday, May 13, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
 
 
Round 2 options:
Tuesday, May 20, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
Tuesday, May 27, 2025
 
– 10 am – 12 pm ET
 
 
Here’s the not-so-great news - our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry and our small firm…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We cannot afford to pay more than $250 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $250*2 hours = $500 * 2 sessions = $1k US (including prep).
 
Would this be something you would be available for and interested in?
 
Later in the year we would ask for your partnership in delivering the 3-hour “Leading Inclusively” course I mentioned above. 
 
Looking forward to hearing from you!
Rebecca
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

PM Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
 
Hi, Jas. We haven’t met, I’m a Principal Consultant at LCW. Your name was forwarded to me by Patricia Coleman (friend and colleague, SIETAR USA in common) and Sarah Nodarse. I understand you worked with us last year, to help Sarah culturally adapt a session for one of our clients (Boston Scientific Corp). Sarah is no longer at LCW, and I am now the account managers for BSC. 
 
We completed the content a few months ago, and the client is now ready to schedule a couple of sessions. Not the same session you helped us with (which is called “Leading Inclusively”) but a pre-req 2-hr session called “Understanding Your Cultural Lens”. We’re looking for a Canadian cultural competence SME and facilitator to help us deliver this course, twice. The target audience are people leaders across departments. 
 
We have the content and facilitator notes ready, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.  Client’s locations in Canada are Brampton, Mississauga, Ottawa, and Montreal.
 
I’m happy to walk you through the content. It does have some content about the Intercultural Development Continuum/ IDI – are you certified in this assessment? And if not, how familiar are you with this material?
 
The client has just proposed the following dates (t
he Client’s Canada team would select 1 date from round 1 and one date from round 2):
 
Round 1 options:
Tuesday, May 6, 2025 – 10 am – 12 pm ET
Tuesday, May 13, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
 
 
Round 2 options:
Tuesday, May 20, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
Tuesday, May 27, 2025
 
– 10 am – 12 pm ET
 
 
Here’s the not-so-great news - our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry and our small firm…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We cannot afford to pay more than $250 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $250*2 hours = $500 * 2 sessions = $1k US (including prep).
 
Would this be something you would be available for and interested in?
 
Later in the year we would ask for your partnership in delivering the 3-hour “Leading Inclusively” course I mentioned above. 
 
Looking forward to hearing from you!
Rebecca
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

External:
 
 
Hi team,
 
Answers for zoom questions below:
 
Can we customize the Zoom registration confirmation email that goes to participants? Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can our Zoom automatically send registrants a calendar invitation? And can we customize the text on it for them?
 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though it's their account the session is made under. 
 
·
                     
How does the reg link work when there are many session dates/times to choose from? Do we give them a different reg link for each session?  A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurrences/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). 
You can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions!
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

subject: Leading Inclusively Canada Dates Proposal
body:
Hi Rebecca and Juri,
 
Rebecca I hope you are having a fantastic vacation and not reading this email until you return. 
 
Juri, could you please let us know if there is any conflict with any of the following dates to facilitate the Leading Inclusively session for Canada? The idea would be to facilitate one session in October and another in November.  Also, I confirming that the LI in Canada takeaway document looks good to use and that we will reassess it after getting feedback from our first sessions.
 
Wednesday, October 22
Thursday, October 23
Wednesday, November 5
Thursday, November 6
 
Thanks,
Evan
 
Evan Tarshish
DE&I Talent Management Principal Specialist
Enterprise Talent Management

subject: Re: GroupM Zoom Questions
body:
Thanks 
@Kaitlin Nonweiler
 can you please confirm that you were able to pull the registration report from the second method of signing up as that is what we used to run this test. I know we should be able to pull but I just want confirmation in case any wired tech stuff comes up with Zoom while pulling so we can troubleshoot before proceeding with the client.
We will not need the first method at the moment but I could see this being used for make up sessions in the future.
Once you confirm the registration was pulled successfully, I will route the confirmation to the client. If this can be done as soon as possible as the client is waiting for this piece to launch their internal comms regarding the sessions.
Thank you!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW
From:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 11:18 AM
To:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: GroupM Zoom Questions
 
 
The first method would be good if the client had a list of people they wanted registered for a certain session, then I would go into Zoom and register them. So if they had people register for a session on their end first, I could then register the participants on our end through Zoom. 
From:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com>
Sent:

Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:

Thank you! I went ahead and registered using the method 2, which is what we will probably want to use as there are multiple sessions and they will want the attendees that are invited to choose the session they want. Please confirm once Chuck and Kimberly have registered and you are able to successfully pull the registration information from Zoom.
I'm assuming the first method would only work if there was one session and everyone would be signed up for it.
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

Method 2: I sent an email to the participants with the invite to register.

From:

Sent:

Subject:
 RE: GroupM Zoom Questions
 
Thanks Juri: 
 
This is super helpful. Would we be able to get regular reporting on the Zoom signups? That is the only other thing missing that we have in our process right now. That would prevent us from sending the reminder emails to people who have already registered and would help us to understand when we are underenrolled in a particular session. 
 
Best,
Brian

From:
 Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 4, 2025 11:06 AM
To:
 Shelton Rankin <
shelton.rankin@groupm.com
>; Brian Dashew <
brian.dashew@groupm.com
>; Lukeisha Paul <
Lukeisha.Paul@groupm.com
>
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 GroupM Zoom Questions
 
External:
 
 
Hi team,
 
Answers for zoom questions below:
 
Can we customize the Zoom registration confirmation email that goes to participants? Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can our Zoom automatically send registrants a calendar invitation? And can we customize the text on it for them?
 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though it's their account the session is made under. 
 
·
                     
How does the reg link work when there are many session dates/times to choose from? Do we give them a different reg link for each session?  A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurrences/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). 
You can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions!
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

subject: Accepted: {External} BSC x LCW Biweekly Meeting
RE: GroupM Zoom Questions
body:
Hi Juri: 
 
We are currently planning on providing the report to Lukeisha and her team weekly.
 
As I mentioned on my call, I am away starting in 15 minutes (
😃
) for the next week. But if you we get confirmation that we can launch and new dates I will still finalize the next set of dates on EventBrite with Brooke next week. Please keep us updated on any final decisions that are made with respect to the comms so that we know when we can get started. 
 
Best,
Brian 
 
BRIAN DASHEW 
(he/him)
Head of Learning, North America
— 
www.groupm.com
 
@groupmworldwide
 
Follow us on LinkedIn

Subject:
 Re: GroupM Zoom Questions
 
External:
 
 
Hi Brian,
 
We are working on testing and confirming the registration reporting with Zoom and will route confirmation as soon as possible. We do not anticipate providing regular reporting on Zoom registration to be an issue. However, I encourage you to keep access to the Eventbright registration until we confirm successful testing. 
 
Can you confirm the frequency in which you want the registration reporting and if there are specific time frames or dates you review this information?
 
I'll keep you posted. 
 
Thank you,
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 GroupM Zoom Questions
 
External:
 
 
Hi team,
 
Answers for zoom questions below:
 
Can we customize the Zoom registration confirmation email that goes to participants? Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can our Zoom automatically send registrants a calendar invitation? And can we customize the text on it for them?
 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though it's their account the session is made under. 
 
·
                
How does the reg link work when there are many session dates/times to choose from? Do we give them a different reg link for each session?  A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurrences/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). 
You can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions!
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

Hello, EMEA Team!
 
The first “Leading Inclusively” for EMEA is coming soon, taking place on March 10
th
 (2 weeks from Monday). 
 
I wanted to let you know that I reviewed the deck and made a few minor updates, and I would also like to update some of the prework quiz questions, since some of them are already a few years old. I’m planning on finishing the updated quiz early next week, after which I’ll send it to you so you can send to your participants. I’ll also send you a copy of the updated deck. 
 
LCW longtime facilitator and intercultural compentence SME, Tatyana Fertelmeyster, will be faciliating the session. Please see attached for her bio. 
 
The registration link is: 
https://languageandculture.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZIscOmprToqH9CLYm-qpIkDiccdLqbcPQca
 
 
Please lmk if you have any questions!
 
Have a wonderful weekend,
Rebecca

Hi, Jas. We haven’t met, I’m a Principal Consultant at LCW. Your name was forwarded to me by Patricia Coleman (friend and colleague, SIETAR USA in common) and Sarah Nodarse. I understand you worked with us last year, to help Sarah culturally adapt a session for one of our clients (Boston Scientific Corp). Sarah is no longer at LCW, and I am now the account managers for BSC. 
 
We completed the content a few months ago, and the client is now ready to schedule a couple of sessions. Not the same session you helped us with (which is called “Leading Inclusively”) but a pre-req 2-hr session called “Understanding Your Cultural Lens”. We’re looking for a Canadian cultural competence SME and facilitator to help us deliver this course, twice. The target audience are people leaders across departments. 
 
We have the content and facilitator notes ready, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.  Client’s locations in Canada are Brampton, Mississauga, Ottawa, and Montreal.
 
I’m happy to walk you through the content. It does have some content about the Intercultural Development Continuum/ IDI – are you certified in this assessment? And if not, how familiar are you with this material?
 
The client has just proposed the following dates (t
he Client’s Canada team would select 1 date from round 1 and one date from round 2):
 
Round 1 options:
Tuesday, May 6, 2025 – 10 am – 12 pm ET
Tuesday, May 13, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
 
 
Round 2 options:
Tuesday, May 20, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
Tuesday, May 27, 2025
 
– 10 am – 12 pm ET
 
 
Here’s the not-so-great news - our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry and our small firm…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We cannot afford to pay more than $250 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $250*2 hours = $500 * 2 sessions = $1k US (including prep).
 
Would this be something you would be available for and interested in?
 
Later in the year we would ask for your partnership in delivering the 3-hour “Leading Inclusively” course I mentioned above. 
 
Looking forward to hearing from you!
Rebecca

External:
 
 
Hi team,
 
Answers for zoom questions below:
 
Can we customize the Zoom registration confirmation email that goes to participants? Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can our Zoom automatically send registrants a calendar invitation? And can we customize the text on it for them?
 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though it's their account the session is made under. 
 
·
                     
How does the reg link work when there are many session dates/times to choose from? Do we give them a different reg link for each session?  A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurrences/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). 
You can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions!
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

 GroupM Zoom Questions
 
External:
 
 
Hi team,
 
Answers for zoom questions below:
 
Can we customize the Zoom registration confirmation email that goes to participants? Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can our Zoom automatically send registrants a calendar invitation? And can we customize the text on it for them?
 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though it's their account the session is made under. 
 
·
                     
How does the reg link work when there are many session dates/times to choose from? Do we give them a different reg link for each session?  A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurrences/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). 
You can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions!
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

From:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 4, 2025 11:06 AM
To:
 Shelton Rankin <shelton.rankin@groupm.com>; Brian Dashew <brian.dashew@groupm.com>; Lukeisha Paul <Lukeisha.Paul@groupm.com>
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 GroupM Zoom Questions
 
External:
 
 
Hi team,
 
Answers for zoom questions below:
 
Can we customize the Zoom registration confirmation email that goes to participants? Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can our Zoom automatically send registrants a calendar invitation? And can we customize the text on it for them?
 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though it's their account the session is made under. 
 
·
                
How does the reg link work when there are many session dates/times to choose from? Do we give them a different reg link for each session?  A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurrences/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). 
You can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions!
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

subject: Help while Kaitlin is out
body:
Hi Juri,
I hope you are feeling better today.
Question for you - 
As you may know, Kaitlin is pregnant - due in April - and will be taking some time off in the coming weeks.
Would you be interested in helping with her tasks while she is out?
Currently, her main tasks are:
Setting up trainings in Zoom (along with any related polls if they are not set up yet)
Adding trainings to the Scoro calendar (although I'm questioning if this is even necessary...there probably is a better way)
Creating QR codes for sessions
She's been doing around 10 hours per week.
Let me know what you think!
Thank you,
Nicole

On Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 12:41
 
PM Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
 
Hi, Jas. We haven’t met, I’m a Principal Consultant at LCW. Your name was forwarded to me by Patricia Coleman (friend and colleague, SIETAR USA in common) and Sarah Nodarse. I understand you worked with us last year, to help Sarah culturally adapt a session for one of our clients (Boston Scientific Corp). Sarah is no longer at LCW, and I am now the account managers for BSC. 
 
We completed the content a few months ago, and the client is now ready to schedule a couple of sessions. Not the same session you helped us with (which is called “Leading Inclusively”) but a pre-req 2-hr session called “Understanding Your Cultural Lens”. We’re looking for a Canadian cultural competence SME and facilitator to help us deliver this course, twice. The target audience are people leaders across departments. 
 
We have the content and facilitator notes ready, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.  Client’s locations in Canada are Brampton, Mississauga, Ottawa, and Montreal.
 
I’m happy to walk you through the content. It does have some content about the Intercultural Development Continuum/ IDI – are you certified in this assessment? And if not, how familiar are you with this material?
 
The client has just proposed the following dates (t
he Client’s Canada team would select 1 date from round 1 and one date from round 2):
 
Round 1 options:
Tuesday, May 6, 2025 – 10 am – 12 pm ET
Tuesday, May 13, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
 
 
Round 2 options:
Tuesday, May 20, 2025 – 2 pm – 4 pm ET
Tuesday, May 27, 2025
 
– 10 am – 12 pm ET
 
 
Here’s the not-so-great news - our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry and our small firm…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We cannot afford to pay more than $250 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $250*2 hours = $500 * 2 sessions = $1k US (including prep).
 
Would this be something you would be available for and interested in?
 
Later in the year we would ask for your partnership in delivering the 3-hour “Leading Inclusively” course I mentioned above. 
 
Looking forward to hearing from you!
Rebecca
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)

subject: RE: GroupM Zoom Questions
body:
Thanks Juri: 
 
This is super helpful. Would we be able to get regular reporting on the Zoom signups? That is the only other thing missing that we have in our process right now. That would prevent us from sending the reminder emails to people who have already registered and would help us to understand when we are underenrolled in a particular session. 
 
Best,
Brian
 
BRIAN DASHEW 
(he/him)
Head of Learning, North America
— 
www.groupm.com
 
@groupmworldwide
 
Follow us on LinkedIn
 
 
 
From:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 4, 2025 11:06 AM
To:
 Shelton Rankin <shelton.rankin@groupm.com>; Brian Dashew <brian.dashew@groupm.com>; Lukeisha Paul <Lukeisha.Paul@groupm.com>
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 GroupM Zoom Questions
 
External:
 
 
Hi team,
 
Answers for zoom questions below:
 
Can we customize the Zoom registration confirmation email that goes to participants? Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can our Zoom automatically send registrants a calendar invitation? And can we customize the text on it for them?
 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though it's their account the session is made under. 
 
·
                
How does the reg link work when there are many session dates/times to choose from? Do we give them a different reg link for each session?  A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurrences/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). 
You can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions!
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

subject: Re: GroupM Zoom Registration Questions
body:
Juri, Please see the answers to your questions below. I hope this helps! :) 
Can the Zoom link registration email that will go out after a participant registers be customizable so that it is easy to search in their email? 
Yes, the Zoom registration confirmation email can be customized. You can customize the email subject, body of the email, and you can add branding. 
 
Can we set up calendar invitations with zoom registration? For example, once someone registers is there an option to include the event on their calendar?
 
Yes, the  Zoom registration confirmation email typically includes an option to add the session details to a participant's calendar by clicking an "Add to Calendar" button, allowing them to add the event to their calendar. But THEY have to click the button and add it.  And I can change the email contact to someone besides the primary host, even though its their account the session is made under. 
Since there are multiple sessions happening on multiple days, how does this work with zoom registration? Currently I understand that for zoom registration we get a link that would take the participant to the registration page and then when they register, they get a unique link.
A Zoom meeting can have what they call multiple "occurrences." When you select that registration for the occurances/sessions is required, you get to choose from three options (see below). I think this also answers your last question. 
Can we input multiple dates and times for them to choose on that registration page or will we need to have a registration page for every session? 
Yes, you can set up the registration page to have multiple dates and times for them to choose from. See the example below. No need for a registration page per session. 
-Kaitlin 
From:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, March 3, 2025 10:46 AM
To:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 GroupM Zoom Registration Questions
 
 
Hello Kaitlin,
I was wondering if you could provide clarity on the following questions regarding Zoom invitation set up in the scenario that a client wanted to have registered zoom links:
Can the Zoom link registration  email that will go out after a participant registers be customizaible so that it is easy to search in their email?
Can we set up calendar invitations with zoom registration? For example, once someone registers is there an option to include the event on their calendar?
Since there are multiple sessions happening on multiple days, how does this work with zoom registration? Currently I understand that for zoom registration we get a link that would take the participant to the registration page and then when they register, they get a unique link.
      Can we input multiple dates and times for them to choose on that registration page or will we need to       have a registration page for every session?
Thanks!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

Le jeu. 19 déc. 2024 à 19:36, Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
> a écrit :
Hi Yuko,
I hope you are well! You come highly recommended by my friend/colleague Patricia Coleman. I am a Project Manager with LCW, as you know from working on the UL Solutions Global Inclusion Forum.
We've been booked to deliver a few virtual workshops for Asia Pacific people leaders from one of our global clients, a large medical devices company. One session is a 2-hour foundational intercultural competence session called "Understanding Your Cultural Lens," and the other is a 3-hour session called "Leading Inclusively." We don't have exact dates yet but have been told they will take place in March/April/May and August/September/October of 2025. We're looking for a skilled and experienced intercultural competence SME/facilitator with an APAC cultural background who would be available and interested in facilitating these sessions for us. The client has leaders in Japan, China, South Korea, India, and five countries in Southeast Asia.
The workshops will be delivered in English, but the client has requested multilingual facilitators just in case it's necessary to revert to participants' native language to answer a question. We're also speaking with a native Chinese speaker, for example. The sessions, which will have about 50 participants each (max), will also need to be delivered during reasonable hours in the region (from India to the Philippines).
We’re in the early stages of planning, but we've begun looking for people potentially interested in working with us on this project. Can you possibly give us an idea of your fee for such a project (assuming you facilitate two "UYCL" sessions and two "Leading Inclusively" sessions)? The content is complete, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.
Also, is this your most recent bio? If not, would you mind sharing an updated bio with us? What is your experience facilitating such workshops for corporates?
Arigato!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

Hi Yuko!
 
I hope you are well and staying warm, my friends in Kansai are saying it's been particularly cold this year! We almost had snow in Tokyo last week. I have more information regarding sessions below:
 
2-hr “Understanding Your Cultural Lens” on Friday, March 7th at 11am Beijing time (Thu @ 9pm CT)
3-hour “Leading Inclusively” on Friday, March 21st probably at the same time
 
The audience will be comprised of ~50 HR and Talent Management folks from across APAC (I believe Singapore, Malaysia, India, China [Shanghai, Chengdu, Taipei], Japan). The sessions are meant for people leaders, but the HR folks are experiencing it first to help advocate, clarify and support future participants through their HR channels.
 
Our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry, as I’m sure you’re well aware…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We can’t afford to pay more than $300 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $300*2 + $300*3 = $1500 for both sessions including prep. 
 
Let me know what you think.

Le jeu. 19 déc. 2024 à 19:36, Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
> a écrit :
Hi Yuko,
I hope you are well! You come highly recommended by my friend/colleague Patricia Coleman. I am a Project Manager with LCW, as you know from working on the UL Solutions Global Inclusion Forum.
We've been booked to deliver a few virtual workshops for Asia Pacific people leaders from one of our global clients, a large medical devices company. One session is a 2-hour foundational intercultural competence session called "Understanding Your Cultural Lens," and the other is a 3-hour session called "Leading Inclusively." We don't have exact dates yet but have been told they will take place in March/April/May and August/September/October of 2025. We're looking for a skilled and experienced intercultural competence SME/facilitator with an APAC cultural background who would be available and interested in facilitating these sessions for us. The client has leaders in Japan, China, South Korea, India, and five countries in Southeast Asia.
The workshops will be delivered in English, but the client has requested multilingual facilitators just in case it's necessary to revert to participants' native language to answer a question. We're also speaking with a native Chinese speaker, for example. The sessions, which will have about 50 participants each (max), will also need to be delivered during reasonable hours in the region (from India to the Philippines).
We’re in the early stages of planning, but we've begun looking for people potentially interested in working with us on this project. Can you possibly give us an idea of your fee for such a project (assuming you facilitate two "UYCL" sessions and two "Leading Inclusively" sessions)? The content is complete, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.
Also, is this your most recent bio? If not, would you mind sharing an updated bio with us? What is your experience facilitating such workshops for corporates?
Arigato!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

Le jeu. 19 déc. 2024 à 19:36, Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
> a écrit :
Hi Yuko,
I hope you are well! You come highly recommended by my friend/colleague Patricia Coleman. I am a Project Manager with LCW, as you know from working on the UL Solutions Global Inclusion Forum.
We've been booked to deliver a few virtual workshops for Asia Pacific people leaders from one of our global clients, a large medical devices company. One session is a 2-hour foundational intercultural competence session called "Understanding Your Cultural Lens," and the other is a 3-hour session called "Leading Inclusively." We don't have exact dates yet but have been told they will take place in March/April/May and August/September/October of 2025. We're looking for a skilled and experienced intercultural competence SME/facilitator with an APAC cultural background who would be available and interested in facilitating these sessions for us. The client has leaders in Japan, China, South Korea, India, and five countries in Southeast Asia.
The workshops will be delivered in English, but the client has requested multilingual facilitators just in case it's necessary to revert to participants' native language to answer a question. We're also speaking with a native Chinese speaker, for example. The sessions, which will have about 50 participants each (max), will also need to be delivered during reasonable hours in the region (from India to the Philippines).
We’re in the early stages of planning, but we've begun looking for people potentially interested in working with us on this project. Can you possibly give us an idea of your fee for such a project (assuming you facilitate two "UYCL" sessions and two "Leading Inclusively" sessions)? The content is complete, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.
Also, is this your most recent bio? If not, would you mind sharing an updated bio with us? What is your experience facilitating such workshops for corporates?
Arigato!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

As soon as I get the signed contract back from you, I’ll send you the workshop materials! (PPT deck, which contains facilitator/speaker notes, and timed agenda). Le jeu. 19 déc. 2024 à 19:36, Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
> a écrit :
Hi Yuko,
I hope you are well! You come highly recommended by my friend/colleague Patricia Coleman. I am a Project Manager with LCW, as you know from working on the UL Solutions Global Inclusion Forum.
We've been booked to deliver a few virtual workshops for Asia Pacific people leaders from one of our global clients, a large medical devices company. One session is a 2-hour foundational intercultural competence session called "Understanding Your Cultural Lens," and the other is a 3-hour session called "Leading Inclusively." We don't have exact dates yet but have been told they will take place in March/April/May and August/September/October of 2025. We're looking for a skilled and experienced intercultural competence SME/facilitator with an APAC cultural background who would be available and interested in facilitating these sessions for us. The client has leaders in Japan, China, South Korea, India, and five countries in Southeast Asia.
The workshops will be delivered in English, but the client has requested multilingual facilitators just in case it's necessary to revert to participants' native language to answer a question. We're also speaking with a native Chinese speaker, for example. The sessions, which will have about 50 participants each (max), will also need to be delivered during reasonable hours in the region (from India to the Philippines).
We’re in the early stages of planning, but we've begun looking for people potentially interested in working with us on this project. Can you possibly give us an idea of your fee for such a project (assuming you facilitate two "UYCL" sessions and two "Leading Inclusively" sessions)? The content is complete, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.
Also, is this your most recent bio? If not, would you mind sharing an updated bio with us? What is your experience facilitating such workshops for corporates?
Arigato!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

We’re definitely committed to readjusting our rates as soon as our finances stabilize. Unfortunately, it’s hard to predict when that will be…
 
As soon as I get the signed contract back from you, I’ll send you the workshop materials! (PPT deck, which contains facilitator/speaker notes, and timed agenda). We’ll set up one or more meetings to talk and go over the content, make sure you understand the client context and are comfortable with the material.

Thank you for your flexibility and we’re very much looking forward to working with you on this project!
 
Rebecca

Le jeu. 19 déc. 2024 à 19:36, Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
> a écrit :
Hi Yuko,
I hope you are well! You come highly recommended by my friend/colleague Patricia Coleman. I am a Project Manager with LCW, as you know from working on the UL Solutions Global Inclusion Forum.
We've been booked to deliver a few virtual workshops for Asia Pacific people leaders from one of our global clients, a large medical devices company. One session is a 2-hour foundational intercultural competence session called "Understanding Your Cultural Lens," and the other is a 3-hour session called "Leading Inclusively." We don't have exact dates yet but have been told they will take place in March/April/May and August/September/October of 2025. We're looking for a skilled and experienced intercultural competence SME/facilitator with an APAC cultural background who would be available and interested in facilitating these sessions for us. The client has leaders in Japan, China, South Korea, India, and five countries in Southeast Asia.
The workshops will be delivered in English, but the client has requested multilingual facilitators just in case it's necessary to revert to participants' native language to answer a question. We're also speaking with a native Chinese speaker, for example. The sessions, which will have about 50 participants each (max), will also need to be delivered during reasonable hours in the region (from India to the Philippines).
We’re in the early stages of planning, but we've begun looking for people potentially interested in working with us on this project. Can you possibly give us an idea of your fee for such a project (assuming you facilitate two "UYCL" sessions and two "Leading Inclusively" sessions)? The content is complete, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.
Also, is this your most recent bio? If not, would you mind sharing an updated bio with us? What is your experience facilitating such workshops for corporates?
Arigato!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

Thank you, Yuko. We’re delighted to be working with you on both sessions Juri described below!
 
I’ll write up a contract and send it to you today. You don’t need to complete anything else, as I know you’ve worked with us before and you have already signed the General Contractor Agreement and W9.
 
We have always prided ourselves in paying our external consultants commensurate with their experience and skills, so this really pains us (though not as much as it pains you, I realize). We’re definitely committed to readjusting our rates as soon as our finances stabilize. Unfortunately, it’s hard to predict when that will be…
 
As soon as I get the signed contract back from you, I’ll send you the workshop materials! (PPT deck, which contains facilitator/speaker notes, and timed agenda). We’ll set up one or more meetings to talk and go over the content, make sure you understand the client context and are comfortable with the material.
 
We’ll also pass along information about the participant group (roles, cultures) as soon as we get that info from the client. 
 
Thank you for your flexibility and we’re very much looking forward to working with you on this project!
 
Rebecca

I hope you are well and staying warm, my friends in Kansai are saying it's been particularly cold this year! We almost had snow in Tokyo last week. I have more information regarding sessions below:
 
2-hr “Understanding Your Cultural Lens” on Friday, March 7th at 11am Beijing time (Thu @ 9pm CT)
3-hour “Leading Inclusively” on Friday, March 21st probably at the same time
 
The audience will be comprised of ~50 HR and Talent Management folks from across APAC (I believe Singapore, Malaysia, India, China [Shanghai, Chengdu, Taipei], Japan). The sessions are meant for people leaders, but the HR folks are experiencing it first to help advocate, clarify and support future participants through their HR channels.
 
Our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry, as I’m sure you’re well aware…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We can’t afford to pay more than $300 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $300*2 + $300*3 = $1500 for both sessions including prep. 
 
Let me know what you think.

Le jeu. 19 déc. 2024 à 19:36, Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
> a écrit :
Hi Yuko,
I hope you are well! You come highly recommended by my friend/colleague Patricia Coleman. I am a Project Manager with LCW, as you know from working on the UL Solutions Global Inclusion Forum.
We've been booked to deliver a few virtual workshops for Asia Pacific people leaders from one of our global clients, a large medical devices company. One session is a 2-hour foundational intercultural competence session called "Understanding Your Cultural Lens," and the other is a 3-hour session called "Leading Inclusively." We don't have exact dates yet but have been told they will take place in March/April/May and August/September/October of 2025. We're looking for a skilled and experienced intercultural competence SME/facilitator with an APAC cultural background who would be available and interested in facilitating these sessions for us. The client has leaders in Japan, China, South Korea, India, and five countries in Southeast Asia.
The workshops will be delivered in English, but the client has requested multilingual facilitators just in case it's necessary to revert to participants' native language to answer a question. We're also speaking with a native Chinese speaker, for example. The sessions, which will have about 50 participants each (max), will also need to be delivered during reasonable hours in the region (from India to the Philippines).
We’re in the early stages of planning, but we've begun looking for people potentially interested in working with us on this project. Can you possibly give us an idea of your fee for such a project (assuming you facilitate two "UYCL" sessions and two "Leading Inclusively" sessions)? The content is complete, and we would of course ensure you are prepared and have everything you need to facilitate effectively.
Also, is this your most recent bio? If not, would you mind sharing an updated bio with us? What is your experience facilitating such workshops for corporates?
Arigato!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW

subject: Scheduling BSC sessions in March and May
body:
Hi there, 
Ramadan Kareem, Juri. 
 
Wondering if on Monday you could fill out the scheduling template for 
@Kaitlin Nonweiler
 for the following BSC sessions (and please ensure they’re reflected in Compass):
 
BSC APAC:
“Understanding Your Cultural Lens” on Wed, March 26
th
 from 11am to 1pm 
Singapore time
 (11pm on Tue 3/25 in ET). Facilitator is external, and her name is Yuko Deneuville. Please create a Zoom registration link for this session.
“Leading Inclusively” on Thu, March 27
th
 from 11am to 2pm 
Singapore time
 (11pm on Tue 3/25 in ET). Facilitator is external, and her name is Yuko Deneuville. Please create a separate, different Zoom registration link for this session.
 
BSC Canada:
“Understanding Your Cultural Lens” on Tuesday, May 13, 2025 from 2 pm – 4 pm ET.  Facilitator is external, and her name is Jas Kalra. Please create a Zoom registration link for this session.
“Understanding Your Cultural Lens” on Tuesday, May 27, 2025 from 10am – 12 pm ET.  Facilitator is external, and her name is Jas Kalra. Please create a Zoom registration link for this session.
 
Thank you!
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
